## Natural history notes

The fringed diving beetle (Cybister fimbriolatus) is an aquatic insect in the diving beetle family. This scavenger feeds on dead insects, small fish, and snails. It is widespread in the eastern United States and occurs throughout Florida. Fringed diving beetles inhabit small freshwater bodies and are most easily observed using a dip net.
